xPair

public boolean xPair(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand,
                     int x)
Tests for X Pair in a hand of Cards

Parameters:
hand - Hand of Cards to test
x - How many pairs you would like to test for. For example, if you want to test if a hand is a two pair, this value would equal 2. If you want to test if a hand has a pair, this value would equal 1.
Returns:
true if an x pair has been found, Boolean.FALSE if an x pair has not been found

xOfAKind

public java.util.ArrayList<Card> xOfAKind(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand,
                                          int x)
Tests for X of a Kind in a hand of Cards

Parameters:
hand - Hand of Cards to test
x - How much of a kind you would like to test for. For example, if you want to test if a hand contains four of a kind, this value would equal 4. If you want to test if a hand contains three of a kind, this value would equal 3.
Returns:
true if the hand contains x of a kind, Boolean.FALSE if the hand does not contain x of a kind

consecutiveFaceValues

public boolean consecutiveFaceValues(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand,
                                     int numberOfConsecutiveCards)
Tests for a certain number of consecutive face values

Parameters:
hand - The hand to be tested
numberOfConsecutiveCards - The number of consecutive face values to be found
Returns:
true if there are consecutive face values of a specific amount

testSpecificFaceValueForConsecutiveness

private boolean testSpecificFaceValueForConsecutiveness(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list,
                                                        int index,
                                                        int nthItemFromFaceValue,
                                                        int numberOfConsecutiveCards)
Tests for a certain number of consecutive Cards

Parameters:
list - An ArrayList containing the face values in a particular hand of Cards sorted by face value from least to greatest
index - Index used to progress through the faces in a consecutive manner
nthItemFromFaceValue - Used to reach a base case. Must be 0 when initially calling this method
numberOfConsecutiveCards - Number of consecutive Cards to test. For example, if you would like to test for five consecutive Cards, this value would equal 5.
Returns:
true if consecutive values have been found, false if consecutive face values have not been found

sameSuit

public boolean sameSuit(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
Tests to see if the hand has cards all from the same suit

Parameters:
hand - The hand to be tested
Returns:
true if the cards are all of the same suit, false if the cards are not of the same suit
